TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ClientBuildManagerCallback extends System.MarshalByRefObject

Docs.summary: Receives status information about a build from the object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A <xref:System.Web.Compilation.ClientBuildManagerCallback> object can be passed to the <xref:System.Web.Compilation.ClientBuildManager> object through the <xref:System.Web.Compilation.ClientBuildManager.PrecompileApplication%2A> method. When an error is encountered during an application build, the error is passed as an argument to either the <xref:System.Web.Compilation.ClientBuildManagerCallback.ReportCompilerError%2A> or the <xref:System.Web.Compilation.ClientBuildManagerCallback.ReportParseError%2A> method, depending on the type of error. When you create a class that derives from the <xref:System.Web.Compilation.ClientBuildManagerCallback> class, you can implement these methods and retrieve the error.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance object InitializeLifetimeService() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a lifetime service object that can be used to control the lifetime policy for this instance.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ReportCompilerError(class System.CodeDom.Compiler.CompilerError error) cil managed

Docs.param: The error or warning encountered during compilation.
Docs.summary: Reports compilation errors and warnings that occur during an application build.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ReportParseError(class System.Web.ParserError error) cil managed

Docs.param: The error or warning encountered during parsing.
Docs.summary: Reports parsing errors and warnings that occur during an application build.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ReportProgress(string message) cil managed

Docs.param: A containing the current status of the build.
Docs.summary: Reports the progress of an application build.
